column4: Might anyone know why 70% of the times I start my system my wireless adapter can't pickup any networks ?
you are too far away from the access point ?
no, I have a few dozens networks around me the only issue is that I can't pickup any of them.
iwlist scan returns 'no scan results'
what helps you connect after all ?
rebooting the system until it is able to pickup network's around me
sometimes I don't mind doing it..but heck...yesterday I had to reboot 10 times :D
what's your hardware ?
04:00.0 Network controller: Broadcom Corporation BCM4313 802.11b/g/n Wireless LAN Controller (rev 01)
I did activate the driver trough the 'Additional Drivers'
don't you think that there are some hindering waves, obstacles etc ?
No it's impossible. As I told you I've get a few dozens of access points around me. I even got one in the next room and It also happens when I'm like 1m away from it.
It's got to be a driver issue.
haven't you ever tried another OS ?
no, but few months ago I was using OpenSuse and I had on such problems.
yeah, I'm going to exclude hardware issues by recommending you trying some other operating system
I'd recommend some live-cd(live-usb) distros as they have all the stuff you need and fresh(another) drivers
well I had no problem while using OpenSUSE.. so I'm a bit confused
have not you tried googling about your Wi-Fi adapter and operating system you use ?May be it is quite widespread ?
well it is actually..I had found a fix for it back in the 10.10  time but I don't seem to find it again.
I think I'll do something stupid, I'll install the package from oneric for my wireless card. Maybe it'll fix it..
in your case you should try everything) but do not forget about data backup, etc.
so far I rebooted 3 times...it worked every time
